text: Under the Volcano is a novel by Malcolm Lowry first sold in 1947. ==Plot summary== The events of the novel happen over one day in 1938 where a Mexican festival is taking place. Geoffrey Firmin is a smart British man living in Mexico. He wants to write a book but he drinks too much alcohol. Geoffrey's wife, Yvonne, is fed up of his drinking. She once had an affair with Geoffrey's brother Hugh. ==Related pages== *Le Monde's 100 Books of the Century ==Other websites== * *A Hypertextual Companion to Under the Volcano by Chris Ackerley Category:English-language novels Category:1947 books
